channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2024040152
item.description:
Report E-2024040152

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XTM contacted ERTS regarding a punctured leaking tote containing Predator MR2516. The tote was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 35-gallons of product onto the wooden trailer floor and concrete underneath the trailer. The trailer floor impact area was 18'x18' and the impact area underneath the trailer was 8'x20'. A Contractor performed a tote transfer, cut-up pallets that were impacted by the release, and cleaned-up the release on the trailer floor. Five drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024040022
item.description:
Report X-2024040022

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO, CLEANED UP, AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP. UPON INSPECTION IN THE DMP IT WAS FOUND THAT THE CAPS OF 3 OUT OF 4 1 GALLON BOTTLES WERE LOOSE AND THE CONTAINERS LEAKED. THE 4TH BOTTLE WAS NOT LEAKING BUT THE LABEL AND BOTTLE WERE SOILED AND WET FROM THE OTHER LEAKERS.

item.title: Report E-2024040053
item.description:
Report E-2024040053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was unloading the IBCs from a trailer at Veolia's ten day intransit facility and noticed that six out of the twelve bags had leaked inside the trailer. The waste was F039 filter cake that should have been all solid but instead had residual liquid left over from the process. Over time, the liquid settled out and leaked from the package. The liquid that leaked was absorbed with oil dry and the material was repacked before being shipped to the disposal facility.
